title: Eagle wearing GPS collar racks up huge data roaming bill flying across borders
text:

A migrating Russian eagle has racked up hundreds of pounds in roaming charges after flying across borders.

A female eagle has landed Russian scientists with a hefty bill after being fitted with a device to track her migration path roamed to Kazakhstan that pinged messages back to the research team.

The Russian scientists were monitoring 13 birds in their routes from Siberia when one of the steppe eagles, named Min, flew to an area without mobile coverage in the country.

She stayed in Kazakhstan almost four months before flying a circuitous route to land in Iran.

It was there all the previously unsent messages unloaded at once.

(Image: Elena Shneider/The Siberian Time)

(Image: Igor Karyakin/The Siberian Times)

Unfortunately for Russia's Wild Animal Rehabilitation Centre in Novosibirsk, the roaming charges racked up by the eagle were “astronomical.”

Russian reports say the scientists are now crowdfunding after they were landed with a bill running into “hundreds of pounds”.

Had the GPS location messages been sent from Kazakhstan, the charges would reportedly have been tiny in comparison.

But in Iran each text message cost around 60p. Novosibirsk ornithologist Elena Schneider said: “She sent us (all at once) hundreds of expensive SMSs with her summer locations ... spending the entire collective (phone) budget for our eagles.”

(Image: Elena Schneider/The Siberian Tim)

The scientists have started a campaign called 'Top up the eagle's mobile' to fund Min’s expensive foreign travel."We cannot let the eagles stop broadcasting - this is a very important study with interesting results,” the centre's statement said.

On an earlier flight south from Russia, Min had ventured as far south as India.

Other eagles had far more modest roaming charges.

The BBC reports mobile phone provider Megafon has offered to pay the eagle's bill to enable the scientists to continue their work tracking the birds' migration habits.
description: Min the steppe eagle caused a massive data roaming bill for Russian scientists tracking her when her device started pinging messages home from Iran
